page.title: 12ABERDYFI LIFEBOAT STATION
page.content: Aberdyfi was a busy port in the mid nineteenth century with its own lifeboat station.Established in 1850 the station was located in a special building in Penhelig.This building is now part of a garage.The wooden slipway still leads down to the waters edge.Between 1850 and when it closed in 1931 there were 31 launches and 51 lives saved. An inshore rescue boat was housed in part of the old wharf buildings in 1963.Today the station is manned by villagers and staff from the Outward Bound Sea School. The present lifeboat is called out approximately 30 times per year making an average of 12/13 rescues.Tourists using an assortment of canoes, dinghies,inflatables and more recently sail boards provide the majority of today's incidents.
